block.p: Around Town
Museums and Sites

AMERICAN MUSEUM OF NATURAL HISTORY Central Park West and 79th Street. Through April 6, 2008, ''Beyond,'' an exhibition of more than 30 large-format photographs of Earth's planetary neighbors, in the museum's Imax Gallery. Through Jan. 6, ''The Unknown Audubons: Mammals of North America,'' a display of more than 40 artworks depicting animals. Through May 28, ''The Butterfly Conservatory: Tropical Butterflies Alive in Winter,'' a display with hundreds of butterflies in a re-creation of their natural habitat. Through Aug. 19, ''Gold,'' with coins, jewelry and other artifacts. Timed tickets to ''Gold'' and ''The Butterfly Conservatory,'' which include museum admission, are $21; $16 for students and 60+; $12 for 12 and younger. Suggested museum admission: $14; $10.50 for students and 60+; children, $8. Combination tickets, including museum and Rose Center admission and the Hayden Planetarium space show (''Cosmic Collisions''): $22; $16.50 for students and 60+; $13 for 12 and younger; under 2, free. Admission that includes all activities: $30; $23 for students and 60+; $19 for 12 and younger. Museum hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5:45 p.m. (to 8:45 p.m. on Fridays). (212) 769-5100 or (212) 769-5200; amnh.org.

MERCHANT'S HOUSE MUSEUM, 29 East Fourth Street, East Village. Tomorrow and Sunday, special guided tours of the house including the servants' quarters, which are normally closed to visitors. Hours: Thursdays through Mondays, noon to 5 p.m. $8, $5 for students and 65+, free for members and under 12. (212) 777-1089.

MUSEUM OF JEWISH HERITAGE (A LIVING MEMORIAL TO THE HOLOCAUST), 18 First Place, at West Street and Battery Place, Battery Park City, Lower Manhattan. Through Oct. 8, ''From the Heart: The Photojournalism of Ruth Gruber.'' Through July 2008, ''Daring to Resist: Jewish Defiance in the Holocaust,'' an exhibition of photographs, objects and documents. Sundays through Tuesdays, and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5:45 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. $10; 65+, $7; students, $5; under 12 and Wednesdays from 4 to 8 p.m. Free. (646) 437-4200; mjhnyc.org.

MUSEUM OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK, Fifth Avenue at 103rd Street. Tomorrow at 3 p.m., a performance by the Asase Yaa African-American Dance Theater. Sunday at 2 p.m., a screening of the 1975 film ''Hester Street,'' with a discussion with its director, Joan Micklin Silver. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Suggested admission: $9; $5 for students and 62+; free for children under 12; $20 for families; free on Sundays, 10 a.m. to noon. (212) 534-1672, mcny.org.

NATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAN INDIAN, United States Custom House, 1 Bowling Green, Lower Manhattan.Tomorrow night at 7, a performance by the Thunderbird Indian Dancers and Singers, with dancing open to all. Free. (212) 514-3700, www.nmai.si.edu.
Gardens

NEW YORK BOTANICAL GARDEN, Southern Boulevard and 200th Street, Bedford Park, the Bronx. Tomorrow and Sunday, ''Gardening in a Changing Climate,'' a weekend of special events, including forest tours, a film screening and workshops. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Parking, $10. $18; students and 62+, $16; children under 13, $5. Garden grounds admission: $6; $3 for 62+; $2 for students; $1 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Combination ticket, including all admissions and a tram tour: $13; $11 for students and 62+; $5 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Tram tours daily, every 20 minutes. Conservatory admission: $5; $4 for students and 62+; $3 for children 2 to 12; free for children under 2. Grounds admission free on Wednesdays and 10 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. (718) 817-8700; nybg.org.

WAVE HILL, Independence Avenue and West 249th Street, Riverdale, the Bronx. Tomorrow and Sunday, an ''Earth Day Weekend,'' with special events including a garden walk, a woodland cleanup and a family art workshop. Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. $4; $2 for students and 65+; free for children under 6 at all times and for everyone all day Tuesdays and 9 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. (718) 549-3200.
Events
MANHATTAN VINTAGE CLOTHING AND ANTIQUE TEXTILE SHOW AND SALE, Metropolitan Pavilion, 125 West 18th Street, Chelsea. Today, 1 to 8 p.m.; tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. $20. (212) 691-7297.
EARTH DAY NEW YORK, Vanderbilt Avenue, between 42nd and 45th Streets. Today and tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
NINTH PRECINCT COMMUNITY COUNCIL STREET FAIR, Astor Place, between Broadway and Lafayette Streets, East Village. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
16TH WEST SIDE SPRING FESTIVAL, Broadway between 96th and 110th Streets, Upper West Side. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Sponsored by the Veritas Therapeutic Community. (212) 764-6330.
TIMES SQUARE BLOCK PARTY, 45th Street, between Avenue of the Americas and Seventh Avenue. Tomorrow, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.
EARTH AWARENESS DAY FESTIVAL, Waverly Place, from Broadway to Fifth Avenue, West Village. Sunday, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.

AN EVENING WITH FARLEY GRANGER, Film Forum, 209 West Houston Street, west of Avenue of the Americas, South Village. Monday night at 8, a discussion with the actor, with clips from his films. $10.50, $5.50 for members. (212) 727-8110.

27TH NEW YORK INTERNATIONAL ORCHID SHOW, 30 Rockefeller Plaza. Through Sunday, a display of more than 50,000 orchids, co-sponsored by the Greater New York Orchid Society. $5, free for children under 12. Hours, (212) 332-6553; rockefellercenter.com or gnyos.org.
Spoken Word

'HAPPY BIRTHDAY DEAR WILLIAM,' Cornelia Street Cafe, 29 Cornelia Street, West Village. Monday night at 6, a reading of Shakespeare sonnets in celebration of the 443rd anniversary of his birth, with the actors Barbara Feldon, Paul Hecht and Charlotte Parry, and the lute player Hank Heijink. $10. (212) 989-9319.

LITERARY ARTS FESTIVAL, Fort Tilden, Gateway National Recreation Area, Jamaica Bay, Queens. Sunday, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., panel discussions and a screenwriting symposium, featuring writers and screenwriters. Sponsored by the Rockaway Music and Arts Council. Free. (718) 945-6700; rockawaymusicandarts.org.
Walking Tours
OUTDOORS CLUB Tomorrow at 1:30 p.m., a four-mile ''Doggie Hike in Forest Park,'' meeting in Queens at Queens Boulevard and Kew Gardens Road. $3. (516) 671-2095.

LOWER EAST SIDE WALKING AND EATING TOUR, Sunday at 4 p.m., a fund-raiser for the Hester Street Collaborative, a community architectural and design organization, meeting at 113 Hester Street; the walk will be followed by a cocktail reception; $150 suggested donation. (212) 431-6780.

BROOKLYN CENTER FOR THE URBAN ENVIRONMENT Tomorrow at 11 a.m., an architectural tour of Bedford-Stuyvesant in Brooklyn, meeting outside the Franklin Avenue subway stop on the C or S trains, at Fulton Street. Sunday at 3 p.m., $13; members, $10; 62+ and students, $8. (718) 788-8500, Ext. 208.

NOSHWALKS Tomorrow at 10:45 a.m., ''Bronx Bites,'' visits the multicultural markets of Morris Heights and Woodlawn, meeting in Manhattan at Hue-Man Books, 2319 Frederick Douglass Boulevard, at 124th Street; $43; $40 for subscribers; $20 for students, including lunch. (212) 222-2243; noshwalks.com.

MUNICIPAL ART SOCIETY Sunday at 11 a.m., ''Bushwick: Old and New,'' a Brooklyn neighborhood that is undergoing a residential transformation, meeting at theintersection of Myrtle Avenue and Broadway. $15, for members $12; (212) 439-1049; mas.org.
Recreation

ADIDAS RUN FOR THE PARKS FOUR-MILE AND KIDS' RACES, Central Park. Begins Sunday at 10 a.m. on the East Drive near 68th Street; kids races begin at 8:30 a.m. Sponsored by the New York Road Runners Club. Advance registration: $30; $20 for members; $14 for 18 and younger and 62+. Race-day registration: $35; $25 for members; $15 for 18 and younger and 62+; kids' races, $7, $5 for members. (212) 860-4455; www.nyrrc.org.

M.S. WALKS IN MANHATTAN AND ON STATEN ISLAND Two walks to raise money for multiple sclerosis services and research. Participants in either have a choice of three walks: a 10-mile course; a 6-mile course; or a 3-mile, wheelchair-accessible course. The Staten Island walk begins tomorrow at 10:30 a.m. at Historic Richmond Town; the Manhattan walk begins Sunday at 11 a.m. at South Street Seaport. Sponsored by the New York City chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society. (212) 463-9791 or msnyc.org.
